info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 10:10PM EDT until May 27 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Georgia, including the following counties, Clay, Quitman and Randolph.
* WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1010 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Shellman, Springvale, Springvale Station, Peterson Hill, Morris, Coles, Crossroads, White House, Hatcher, Cotton Hill, Garnersville, Wades, Moores Crossroads, Watson Crossroads, Benevolence, Wire Bridge, Days Crossroads and Bagby State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: Clay, GA; Quitman, GA; Randolph, GA
